meanings.definition: The state or quality of being a saint.
meanings.sent1: Many people admire the sainthoods of Mother Teresa and Saint Francis.
meanings.sent2: The church celebrates the sainthoods of those who have performed miracles.
meanings.sent3: The town's obsession with sainthoods led to a festival in honor of all saints.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness and generosity elevated her to the sainthoods of the community.
meanings.sent5: The sainthoods of the ancient monks inspired generations to follow their path.

meanings.definition: The act of being recognized as a saint by the Catholic Church.
meanings.sent1: The ceremony marked the sainthoods of the newly canonized saints.
meanings.sent2: The process of achieving sainthoods involves rigorous investigation.
meanings.sent3: Becoming a saint requires more than just luck; it's a journey to sainthoods.
meanings.sent4: The sainthoods of the martyrs symbolize unwavering faith and sacrifice.
meanings.sent5: The pope's declaration confirmed the sainthoods of the devoted individuals.
